hi
i dont know about the junitee.but presently we are using super150 -a EJB=
 testing tool which is working quite fine.
if u are using weblogic 5.1 then=
 u can as well go for EJBVerify-an another testing tool
  ----- Original Me=
ssage ----- 
  From: Kaarle Kaila 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wed=
nesday, September 19, 2001 5:28 PM
  Subject: [junit] Testing J2EE applicat=
ions


  I have been looking into ways of testing J2EE
  applications with =
JUnit. Part of my application are
  straight methods that I can test locall=
y but other
  parts requires the J2EE environment to be active
  (weblogic =
in this case). 

  I found a package called junitee at sourgeforge that
  c=
ould test my Java classes or EJB's nicely. 

  Then when was looking for mo=
re info I found the Cactus
  project that looks like it could do this sort =
of
  testing. 

  I have (not yet) managed to use Cactus. I will look
  mor=
e into it but would like to ask your opinion!

  Do you know the status of =
junitee ?
  My email to the author was not delivered ?
  (I made a path to =
it that I tried to send to him)

  With junitee you cannot test jsp-pages b=
ut about all
  the rest if I am not mistaken.

  Is there some other simila=
r interface that would have
  a browser interface?

  regards
  Kaarle Kail=
a / Finland
